_start:
Â Â Â Â /*Â ClearÂ theÂ frameÂ pointer.Â Â TheÂ ABIÂ suggestsÂ thisÂ beÂ done,Â toÂ mark

Â Â Â Â xorlÂ %ebp,Â %ebp

Â Â Â Â /*Â ExtractÂ theÂ argumentsÂ asÂ encodedÂ onÂ theÂ stackÂ andÂ setÂ up
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â theÂ argumentsÂ forÂ `main':Â argc,Â argv.Â Â envpÂ willÂ beÂ determined
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â laterÂ inÂ __libc_start_main.Â Â */

Â Â Â Â movlÂ %esp,Â %ecxÂ Â /*Â argvÂ startsÂ justÂ atÂ theÂ currentÂ stackÂ top.*/

Â Â Â Â /*Â BeforeÂ pushingÂ theÂ argumentsÂ alignÂ theÂ stackÂ toÂ aÂ 16-byte
Â Â Â Â (SSEÂ needsÂ 16-byteÂ alignment)Â boundaryÂ toÂ avoidÂ penaltiesÂ from
Â Â Â Â misalignedÂ accesses.Â Â ThanksÂ toÂ EdwardÂ SeidlÂ <seidl@janed.com>
Â Â Â Â forÂ pointingÂ thisÂ out.Â Â */
Â Â Â Â andlÂ $0xfffffff0,Â %esp
Â Â Â Â pushlÂ %eaxÂ Â /*Â PushÂ garbageÂ becauseÂ weÂ allocate
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 28Â moreÂ bytes.Â Â */

Â Â Â Â /*Â ProvideÂ theÂ highestÂ stackÂ addressÂ toÂ theÂ userÂ codeÂ (forÂ stacks
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â whichÂ growÂ downwards).Â Â */
Â Â Â Â pushlÂ %esp

Â Â Â Â pushlÂ %edxÂ Â /*Â PushÂ addressÂ ofÂ theÂ sharedÂ library
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â terminationÂ function.Â Â */

#ifdefÂ SHARED
Â Â Â Â /*Â LoadÂ PICÂ register.Â Â */
Â Â Â Â callÂ 1f
Â Â Â Â addlÂ $_GLOBAL_OFFSET_TABLE_,Â %ebx

Â Â Â Â /*Â PushÂ addressÂ ofÂ ourÂ ownÂ entryÂ pointsÂ toÂ .finiÂ andÂ .init.Â Â */
Â Â Â Â lealÂ __libc_csu_fini@GOTOFF(%ebx),Â %eax
Â Â Â Â pushlÂ %eax
Â Â Â Â lealÂ __libc_csu_init@GOTOFF(%ebx),Â %eax
Â Â Â Â pushlÂ %eax

Â Â Â Â pushlÂ %ecxÂ Â /*Â PushÂ secondÂ argument:Â argv.Â Â */
Â Â Â Â pushlÂ %esiÂ Â /*Â PushÂ firstÂ argument:Â argc.Â Â */

Â Â Â Â pushlÂ BP_SYMÂ (main)@GOT(%ebx)

Â Â Â Â /*Â CallÂ theÂ user'sÂ mainÂ function,Â andÂ exitÂ withÂ itsÂ value.
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â ButÂ letÂ theÂ libcÂ callÂ main.Â Â Â Â */
Â Â Â Â callÂ BP_SYMÂ (__libc_start_main)@PLT
#else
Â Â Â Â /*Â PushÂ addressÂ ofÂ ourÂ ownÂ entryÂ pointsÂ toÂ .finiÂ andÂ .init.Â Â */
Â Â Â Â pushlÂ $__libc_csu_fini
Â Â Â Â pushlÂ $__libc_csu_init

Â Â Â Â pushlÂ %ecxÂ Â /*Â PushÂ secondÂ argument:Â argv.Â Â */

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â ButÂ letÂ theÂ libcÂ callÂ main.Â Â Â Â */
